pages.title: Overview
pages.content: Anara’s built-in PDF viewer makes it easy to read and work with your documents in one place. Use the panel on the left to switch between page thumbnails, an outline view, or in-document search. You can zoom, navigate between pages, and adjust the view to suit your reading style.

pages.title: Annotate with highlights and comments
pages.content:
Annotations in Anara let you capture, organize, and discuss key information directly within your documents. You can highlight important passages, add color-coded notes, and leave comments for yourself or collaborators — all without leaving the viewer.
​Creating a highlight

Open a document.
Select any text to bring up the annotation toolbar.
Choose a highlight color from the palette to mark the text.
Your highlight will be saved automatically and appear in the Annotations tab on the right-hand panel.

​Adding a comment

After highlighting text, click Comment in the annotation toolbar.
Type your note in the comment box and press Enter to save.
Comments appear in the Annotations tab alongside the highlighted text.

​Viewing and managing

Open the Annotations tab in the right-hand panel to see all highlights and comments for the document.
Click any annotation in the list to navigate instantly to that specific location in the document.
Hover over any highlight to quickly view its associated comments.
